author: adammbq
content: hello guys, L2 uses L1 as data availability layer because data persists. Now with blobs, which expire after 2 weeks, how can we deal with reconstructing L2 states if we no longer have the data?

author: bridge-bot
content: <adietrichs> persistence is exactly the service L1 can no longer provide for L2s as they scale. luckily, it doesnâ€™t need to - L2s just have to take over the responsibility for that. L2s really are their own chains, and need to have their own persistent history layer. L1 data availability is very limited in scope to protect against malicious withholding attacks by sequencers. The data is only made available long enough that honest participants are ensured to have been able to recover and re-seed it to the L2 persistence layer if it was withheld there in the first place.
